meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>slippery</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to slide</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to slip</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: You're about <vocabulary>to slip</vocabulary>, and notice the floor is covered entirely in <reading>souve</reading>nirs (すべ)! Souvenirs of all shapes and sizes are scattered all over the floor, making it extremely easy to slide and slip.
